translations.translation: Nor is it the word of an accursed Shaytan.
This is not the utterance of an accursed devil.
nor is it a word of an accursed Satan.
The Quran is not the word of condemned satan.
And the Qur’an is not the recitation of Satan the outcast.
And it is not the word of the outcast Shaytan.
Nor is it the word of the cursed Shaitan,
And it is not the word of an accursed Satan;
Nor is this the utterance of a devil worthy to be stoned.
Nor is this the word of an outcast devil.
Nor is it the word of a Satan accursed.
And it is not the speech of an outcast Satan.
Nor is it the word of an evil spirit accursed.
And it (the Quran) is not the word of the outcast Shaitan (Satan).
Nor is this the word of a stoned satan.
And it is not the word of an accursed devil.
And the Qur'an is not the word of a devil, expelled [from the heavens].
[81:25] And it, that is, the Qur’ān, is not the word of an accursed satan, eavesdropping stealthily.
(Nor is this) i.e. the Qur'an (the utterance of a devil worthy to be stoned) the utterance of an accursed, rebellious devil whose name is al-Marmi.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
ونزل عيه { بِقَوْلِ شَيْطَانٍ رَّجِيمٍ } [التكوير: 25] أي: ما هو شعر وكهانة ناشئة من شياطين الوهم والخيال
 كما زعمه أهل الزيغ والضلال المترددين في أودية الجهل والغفلة
 وهاوية العناد و الجدال


وبعدما لاح عظم شأن القرآن
 ورفعة قدره
